title: Dick Yost
text:
Richard Lewis Yost (December 27, 1929 – August 3, 1973) was an American amateur <a href="golf">golf</a>er. He played in the <a href="1955%20Walker%20Cup">1955 Walker Cup</a> match.
Golf career.
Yost attended <a href="Oregon%20State%20University">Oregon State University</a> from 1948 to 1951, winning the 1950 Oregon Amateur title during his time there. He won the <a href="Pacific%20Northwest%20Amateur">Pacific Northwest Amateur</a> in 1953 and was selected for the <a href="1955%20Walker%20Cup">1955 Walker Cup</a> on the <a href="Old%20Course%20at%20St%20Andrews">Old Course at St Andrews</a>. The United States won by 10 matches to 2 with Yost winning both of his matches. After his return he won the 1955 <a href="Pacific%20Northwest%20Amateur">Pacific Northwest Amateur</a> and in 1958 he won the <a href="Oregon%20Open">Oregon Open</a>. Yost played just once in the <a href="Masters%20Tournament">Masters</a>, in 1957 when he missed the cut.
Yost was inducted to the <a href="Oregon%20Sports%20Hall%20of%20Fame">Oregon Sports Hall of Fame</a> in 1982, the Oregon State Athletics Hall of Fame in 1990 and the Pacific Northwest Golf Association Hall of Fame in 1991.
